Basic Version

nh = 50

# simplified kaiming init / he init
w1 = torch.randn(m, nh) / math.sqrt(m)
b1 = torch.zeros(nh)
w2 = torch.randn(nh, 1) / math.sqrt(nh)
b2 = torch.zeros(1)

def lin(x, w, b): return x@w + b
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
def relu(x): return x.clamp_min(0.)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
t = relu(lin(x_train, w1, b1))

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
def model(xb):
    l1 = lin(xb, w1, b1)
    l2 = relu(l1)
    l3 = lin(l2, w2, b2)
    return l3
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

Loss function - MSE

{% raw %} 
model(x_valid).shape
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
def mse(output, targs): return (output.squeeze(-1)-targs).pow(2).mean()
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
y_train, y_valid = y_train.float(), y_valid.float()
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
preds = model(x_train)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
preds.shape
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
mse(preds, y_train)
{% endraw %}

Gradients and backwards pass

{% raw %} 
def mse_grad(inp, targ):
    # grad of loss with respect to output of previous layer
    inp.g =  2.0 * (inp.squeeze() - targ).unsqueeze(-1) / inp.shape[0]
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
def relu_grad(inp, out):
    # grad of relu with respect to input  activations
    inp.g = (inp>0).float() * out.g
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
def lin_grad(inp, out, w, b):
    # grad of matmul with respect ot input
    inp.g = out.g @ w.t()
    w.g = (inp.unsqueeze(-1) * out.g.unsqueeze(1)).sum(0)
    b.g = out.g.sum(0)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
def forward_and_backward(inp, targ):
    # forward pass:
    l1 = inp @ w1 + b1
    l2 = relu(l1)
    out = l2 @ w2 + b2
    # we don't actually need the loss in backward!
    loss = mse(out, targ)
    
    # backward pass:
    mse_grad(out, targ)
    lin_grad(l2, out, w2, b2)
    relu_grad(l1, l2)
    lin_grad(inp, l1, w1, b1)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
forward_and_backward(x_train, y_train)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
# save for testing against later
w1g = w1.g.clone()
w2g = w2.g.clone()
b1g = b1.g.clone()
b2g = b2.g.clone()
ig = x_train.g.clone()
{% endraw %}

We cheat a bit and use PyTorch autograd to check our results

{% raw %} 
xt2 = x_train.clone().requires_grad_(True)
w12 = w1.clone().requires_grad_(True)
w22 = w2.clone().requires_grad_(True)
b12 = b1.clone().requires_grad_(True)
b22 = b2.clone().requires_grad_(True)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
def forward(inp, targ):
    # forward pass:
    l1 = inp @ w12 + b12
    l2 = relu(l1)
    out = l2 @ w22 + b22
    # we don't actually need the loss in backward!
    return mse(out, targ)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
loss = forward(xt2, y_train)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
loss.backward()
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
test_close(w22.grad, w2g, eps=1e-3)
test_close(b22.grad, b2g, eps=1e-3)
test_close(w12.grad, w1g, eps=1e-3)
test_close(b12.grad, b1g, eps=1e-3)
test_close(xt2.grad, ig, eps=1e-3)
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

{% endraw %}

Refactor the model

Layers as classes

{% raw %} 
class Relu():
    def __call__(self, inp):
        self.inp = inp
        self.out = inp.clamp_min(0.) - 0.5
        return self.out
    
    def backward(self): self.inp.g = (self.inp>0.).float() * self.out.g
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
class Lin():
    def __init__(self, w, b): self.w, self.b = w, b
    
    def __call__(self, inp):
        self.inp = inp
        self.out = inp @ self.w + self.b
        return self.out
    
    def backward(self):
        self.inp.g = self.out.g @ self.w.t()
        # Creating a giant outer product, just to sum it, is inefficient
        self.w.g = (self.inp.unsqueeze(-1) * self.out.g.unsqueeze(1)).sum(0)
        self.b.g = self.out.g.sum(0)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
class Mse():
    def __call__(self, inp, targ):
        self.inp = inp
        self.targ = targ
        self.out = (inp.squeeze() - targ).pow(2).mean()
        return self.out
    
    def backward(self):
        self.inp.g = 2. * (self.inp.squeeze() - self.targ).unsqueeze(-1) / self.targ.shape[0]
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
class Model():
    def __init__(self, w1, b1, w2, b2):
        self.layers = [Lin(w1, b1), Relu(), Lin(w2, b2)]
        self.loss = Mse()
        
    def __call__(self, x, targ):
        for l in self.layers: x = l(x)
        return self.loss(x, targ)
    
    def backward(self):
        self.loss.backward()
        for l in reversed(self.layers): l.backward()
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
w1.g, b1.g, w2.g, b2.g = [None] * 4
model = Model(w1, b1, w2, b2)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
%time loss = model(x_train, y_train)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
%time model.backward()
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
test_close(w2g, w2.g, eps=1e-3)
test_close(b2g, b2.g, eps=1e-3)
test_close(w1g, w1.g, eps=1e-3)
test_close(b1g, b1.g, eps=1e-3)
test_close(ig, x_train.g, eps=1e-3)
{% endraw %}
